subclassFeature.name: Circle of Kudzu
entries: Druids of the Circle of Kudzu venerate 'weeds', such as their namesake, admiring their swift propagation and small yet hardy stature in the face of adversity. Their magic reflects these traits, capable of rapidly moving across terrain and hindering even the mightiest of foes.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Weeds
entries: {@i 2nd-level Circle of Kudzu feature}
Your affinity for small, strangling plants allows you to wield them effortlessly, granting you these benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip, and can cast it without using verbal or material components.
Your {@spell thorn whip} can target objects and interact with them in the same ways as the {@spell mage hand} cantrip.

You have the {@spell entangle} spell prepared, and can expend a Wild Shape usage as part of casting it to maintain it without {@condition concentration}. The spell ends early if you recast or dismiss it (no action required).
You can pass through any movement impediments caused by nonmagical plants or your own spell effects without being slowed by them.

subclassFeature.name: Lash of a Thousand Thorns
entries: {@i 6th-level Circle of Kudzu feature}
You learn to manipulate your {@spell thorn whip} in a variety of unique ways, providing it with the following benefits:

items: You can change its casting time to a bonus action.
Attack rolls on willing targets automatically hit.
You can choose not to apply damage to a target.
Instead of pulling a creature, you can choose to move it up to 10 feet in any horizontal direction.

entries: Additionally, once per turn, when you hit a target with {@spell thorn whip}, you can cause one of the below effects:

entries.name: Snag
entries: If the target is a creature, you reduce its speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn, and it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Constrict
entries: If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC = your spell save DC) by vines that reach up to the spell's range, occupy the hand you cast the spell with, and disappear when released. Until the grapple ends, you can use your action or bonus action to automatically inflict the effects of {@spell thorn whip} on it again.

entries.name: Ingrain
entries: You pull yourself directly towards the target up to your distance from it. This movement does not provoke opportunty attacks.

entries.name: Uproot
entries: If the target is a creature, you make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by that creature's Strength check. If you succeed, you can pull the creature towards you up to your distance from it.

subclassFeature.name: Endless Entanglement
entries: {@i 10th-level Circle of Kudzu feature}
With enough determination, even the most overlooked of plants can fell the tallest of trees. If you cast {@spell entangle} at a higher level, you can alter it in the following ways:

entries.name: 2nd level or higher
entries: A creature that enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength saving throw as if they were in the area when it was cast or suffer the same effects.

entries.name: 3rd level or higher
entries: You can increase the spell's duration to 1 hour instead of 1 minute.

entries.name: 4th level or higher
entries: Creatures that start their turn restrained by the spell or fail their saving throw against it also take {@dice 3d6} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: 5th level or higher
entries: You can change the spell's area into a 40-foot cube instead of a 20-foot square.

subclassFeature.name: Stride of Boundless Ivy
entries: {@i 14th-level Circle of Kudzu feature}
Your mastery of diminuitive shoots and weeds allows you to call on them with unmatched finesse.

You have the {@spell grasping vine} spell prepared, and can cast it without expending a spell slot. Once you cast {@spell grasping vine} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Additionally, whenever you cast the spell, you can modify its behaviour in the following ways:

items: You can maintain this spell without {@condition concentration}. It ends early if you cast {@spell grasping vine} again.
You can direct the vine on your turn without using a bonus action.
Instead of being pulled 20 feet towards the vine, you can cause the spell to move the target creature anywhere within 30 feet of it.
A creature can choose to fail the spell's save.
You can cause any creature moved by the vine to fall {@condition prone}.
